title: Ryan Giggs tells Ole Gunnar Solskjaer he needs five more big signings at Manchester United
text:
The pressure is building on Solskjaer to deliver results (Picture: Getty)

Ryan Giggs has warned Ole Gunnar Solskjaer he needs at least four more big signings before Manchester United can start challenging for silverware again.

Solskjaer is currently feeling the heat at United after another dismal result away from home against Newcastle United.

The Magpies beat United 1-0 on Sunday and Giggs thinks his former team-mate will need time to get in the players he needs.

‘I see what Ole is doing and I support that,’ he told the Sun. ‘He’s brought in three players, but he probably needs seven or eight.

Giggs played with Solskjaer at United (Picture: Getty)

‘So he needs another four or five. But you can’t do that over one transfer window, so you have to be patient because it will be slow.

‘What he is trying to do was much needed. He needs time.’

After the defeat to Newcastle left United stranded in the bottom half of the Premier League table, Solskjaer called for patience.

‘We’ve given ourselves a big, big uphill challenge to get among the top four but it’s tight and we need to get a run together,’ he said after the game.

‘It will take however long it will have to take. It’s a journey we’ve started on and the culture is getting there.

Defeat to Newcastle has left United in 12th place (Picture: Getty)

‘I can’t give you any time but we’re getting there.

‘We’ve come together and discussed the direction we’re going. If you only work on sunny days, you’ll never get to your destination.

‘We’ll have these days, but we know where we want to get to.’
